alert.note: Alert for Northern Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 5:56AM AKST until January 31 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 inches possible. Winds gusting to 30 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Wind chills to 50 below. * WHERE...Northern Arctic Coast. * WHEN...From noon today to 6 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 50 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow moving north over the area today along with increasing east winds will cause blowing snow with low visibility to develop along with very cold wind chills. These conditions will continue into tonight. The strongest winds and lowest visibility in blowing snow are expected from late this afternoon into tonight. Snow will continue into Tuesday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
